title: Shaco Rework?
body:
i remember seeing years ago that Shaco was getting a rework, and the last I heard was that it was shelved. I'm wondering has there been any progress on Shaco's rework? If not it's fine I was just wondering. 
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

replies.body:
Nothing currently underway. I expect we'll take a look at Shaco to see what can be done if we end up picking assassins as the end of year class update. He's got a lot of game health and counterplay issues, he does some really cool and distincitve stuff too though that matches his thematic extremely well so I think he's potentially a really high value project.  

Even if we do look at assassins at the end of year though (far from guaranteed yet) there's some risk that he turns out to be too big a project to be done properly within the small to medium sized changes of a class update.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=R7KIQtLZ,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-02-24T07:02:22.111+0000)
>
> counterplay issues, 

A mix of any of the following would allow counterplay (all of them, or just one of them):

1) Make a separate item slot for vision wards.

2) Re-introduction of both true-sight trinkets (could even cost money even though the rest are free!) [both = oracle scanner and vision ward trinket]

3) Re-introduction of oracle's elixir. Make sure oracle's elixir is an exception, and CAN be activated with other elixirs (eg: you could have an elixir of sorcery and oracles elixir active at the same time)

I believe that updating Shaco as part of an assassin class update would be unfair for him. He's one of the most outdated champions visually and, IMO, one of the most promising visual updates considering his mysterious concept.

While I he is one of my most hated and annoying champions in the entire game, I do recognise the uniqueness of playing as and against him and would love to see what he would look/feel like if his theme was explored further. The problem is that all of his abilities are pretty much signature apart from his Shiv maybe making the task of reworking him quite difficult.

Shaco should be part of a class update since he's not part of a particular class. In my eyes he is neither an assassin or a light fighter exclusively. He needs more resources that what's available on a class update to actually update this interesting champ.

Here you go, I was nice and kind towards Shaco...



Also, FCK SHACO'S GANKS

you seem to share my opinion on this, honestly I think the safest way to change Shaco without updating the fan base would be not to remove the concept of him useing throwing knives or fear boxes but to rework how he uses them.

I am not sure how but I feel this is where riot should look to improve, for essentialy what makes him such a weak team fighter is that unless he perfectly plants a box ahead of time, he has only 3 moves for fighting in his toolkit for the box can't effectively be used in a team fight, I feel turning the fear box into a team fighting tool instead of a pre set and improve your jungle clear would be much better.

Shaco boxes at the current moment only serve two purposes

-improve clear speed
-set up surprise attacks in the jungle MAYBE (doesnt always get to happen) 

Keap the concept of him useing a box, but change how he fights with it
That's what I feel Riot will try to do. However, I believe that his Shiv could be changed or at least heavily altered because, let's face it, it is a pretty damn dull ability

Updating Shaco to a healthy champ would be pretty easy.

Leave his passive alone.

Deceive should gain damage from AD or AP (Ratio 0.3) which ever is higher.  Static damage:  140 / 160 / 180 / 200 / 220
(Git rid of the crit it is a bit unpredictable in damage and extend the range to the previous flash distance.  He just doesn't have the escape/distance he use to have.  Plus his orange smoke appear in fog of war to players so this really isn't much of a buff.)

Jack in the Box should last about 90 second up from 60 seconds.  Saying the jungle camps will be exploited really is moot since players showed they can still do it with 60 second and other champs like Jhin are now taking advantage of leveling from traps in camps.

Revert the change on Shaco's Two handed shiv to include his base AD and not his bonus AD.  I was just a nerf to him in the guise of a buff.

And lastly leave his Hallucinate the same.

Fixed!  Easy!
I believe you all attempted one but it didn't hit the marks you wanted. Care to share what you tried?  I'm a bit curious.

I remember hearing a story during Yasuo's development where Shaco had a skillshot he would shoot and automatically appear at the target hit, kinda like Lee + liss, except without a choice.

The problem was that at one point Yasuo windwalled it, and shaco never reappeared.

i think shaco's a pretty healthy champion, but his counterplay is removed from the usual "dodge the skillshot" stuff you guys are fond of

there's a lot of mind games you have to play with him and heavy warding is appropriate. really, i think half the reason he's so strong right now is because it's harder to ward against him, especially late game where you don't have slots for pink wards 

he's also the kind of high-risk/reward style of champion that has to play very carefully to get a kill unless he's fed, which i think is a good way of managing assassins

I feel like if everyone that complained about Shaco played a few games with him they'd be so much more prepared to play against him. He's a lot better than most Assassins in the counterplay department (as oppose to counter build), as he doesn't rely on mashing all the buttons as fast as possible to get a kill.

Talking about assassins, thoughts on the current state of Twitch? I think that his intended niche as the assassin ADC wasnt pushed hard enough, his upfront damage after he comes out of invis is pathetic until he gets at least two full items
Twitch is a lategame hypercarry and assassin adc. I believe he is fine where he is.

Would you mind briefly going over his game health and counterplay issues? I've heard a lot of varying opinions on Shaco in that regard so I'm interested in hearing your take on him.

As a guy who just hates Shaco, here are my opinions: One of the biggest problems with him is that Shaco dictates almost everything in an encounter (if played right). If you run from him he has a ranged slow, a gap closer and does bonus damage. If you stay and fight he has a stealth flash and a a fear that does a good chunk of consistent damage. If you try and chase him you should never be able to catch him. Basically, the opponent's level of play is almost irrelevant versus how well the Shaco plays.

Reworking shaco is hard for their is always one or two abilities that everyone completely identifies with a champion. With Shen it is his Taunt and Ultimate, surprise? He kept those. With Poppy it was her Wall stun and Movement speed with her tankier the lower she gets abilitity, she kept those. With Tristana it was her rocket jump and her Q steroid, she kept those. 

I think you are noticing a pattern here, a champion in a major rework in the end always keaps a signature move that makes us go "Yeah that's what makes Shen, Shen"

However when I think of shaco, I think of his entire toolkit, how he annoyingly goes invisible and dashes a million mlies away from me, how he can clone himself and turn a one v into a two v one, how  he can put boxes down, how he throws shivs that slow me so he can catch up and have good ganks.

Shaco is probabbly the hardest champion to rework, for the question is, what do you get rid of, what do you change, and what do you invent for him?

For let's be honest, when we think of Shaco we think of everything that he is, not just one or two abilities.

The only things I can really say they could do something with are his passive and his E, at least when it comes to completely changing an ability. Those two are the ones that can be changed significantly while still being able to retain their feel. But I think you underestimate how much Shaco could be changed just by tweaking his other abilities.

Like his boxes, what is so iconic about them? Suddenly running into a nest of boxes because you got baited by a Shaco. But this means you can change how they deal damage, maybe have them wind up and then explode instead of being DPS traps? Maybe have them be a bit like Zigg's E and have Shaco able to get a short dash if he's near a box when it goes off? You could make his Q invisibility leave behind an after image when he initially stealths so you get an idea of where he went? Maybe it could be a two phase ability where he uses it once and that preps him to deal more damage on his next auto but if he uses it again it will remove that buff and instead stealth him?

Breaking down his abilities helps to get into the more nuanced ways of making them healthier while also still holding true to the spirit of the ability.

Theres a few champions for me who has 4 abilities in their kit that makes me recognize them for who they are.


Shaco, Zed, Katarina, and Leblanc.

For Shaco Passive and E ( the knife throw ) could be reworked actually, but those are so effective for how much are simple that it' s not a real problem for the time being. Maybe he needs just a little modernization, maybe a skill touchup to be more consistent on how he plays, but he is not that far from being alright.
The assassins rework has been announced and even though it wasn't said to happen will shaco get any sort of attention who personally to me is well needed {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
